title: Isolate the Radical
text: Isolate the radical on one side of the equation. We can subtract $$2$$ on both sides get $$\sqrt{2u-3}=-2$$ which has radicals isolated on one side.

title: Check for Value of Square Root Function
text: The square root functions only take positive $$y$$ value. In other word, $$\sqrt{x}=y$$ is defined when $$y$$ is non negative real number.

title: Check for Value of Square Root Function
text: $$\sqrt{2u-3}=-2$$ does not have solution since $$-2$$ is negative.
